status: The authentication module is completed, including login, registration, and JWT token validation. I have tested the APIs using Postman, and everything is working correctly without any major issues.
timeline: We are currently on schedule. According to the sprint plan, the backend development should be completed by Friday, and we are likely to finish one day earlier if everything goes as expected.
blockers: There was a minor issue with database indexing that caused slow queries, but I optimized it by adding proper indexes in the SQLite database. Currently, there are no major blockers.
testing: Unit testing for the authentication module is completed. I am now writing test cases for the tweet creation and deletion APIs. Integration testing will begin tomorrow.
frontend: The frontend team has completed the UI for login and dashboard pages. I am coordinating with them to integrate the APIs and ensure smooth data flow.
performance: The API response time is under 200 milliseconds for most requests. I also implemented proper error handling and optimized queries to maintain performance even with higher loads.
documentation: I have updated the API documentation with request formats, response examples, and error codes. I will also add deployment instructions once the project is finalized.
deployment: We are planning to deploy the backend on a cloud server using Docker containers. Before deployment, we will perform final regression testing to avoid production issues.
teamwork: The team collaboration has been smooth. We are having daily stand-up meetings, and everyone is updating their progress regularly.

confidence: I am confident that we will deliver the project on time with good quality. The current progress and team coordination are very positive.
